message.content: We refer to medical literature sources for help. The symptoms described are consistent with acute graft-versus-host disease (GVHD) which occurs when donor T-cells recognize the recipient's tissues as foreign and attack them. This is more common in solid organ transplantation, but can occur following liver transplant as well. The symptoms described in the question suggest that it is the donor T-cells that are mediating the symptoms.

The symptoms suggest graft-versus-host disease (GVHD), which occurs when the donor T-cells from the transplanted organ react against the recipient's tissues. Therefore, the correct answer is donor T-cells. Recipient T-cells and B-cells would not cause GVHD as they are already present in the recipient's body. Donor B-cells can cause humoral rejection, but this is not consistent with the symptoms described.
